name: Declare as Final all classes that will not be sub-classed
description: This rule shows ABAP classes that do not have subclass and that are not defined with the FINAL addition.
output:
This report lists all ABAP Classes that do not have sub-class and that are not defined as Final.
It provides the following information:
- ABAP Class fullname
rationale:
There can be situations in which it is necessary to protect a whole class from uncontrolled specialization. This could be suitable, for example, if changes must be made to a class without any subclasses becoming syntactically or semantically incorrect.
For a final definition, use the FINAL addition in the CLASS statement.
reference:
An insider's guide to writing robust, understandable, maintainable, state-of-the-art ABAP programs - Part 2
Andreas Blumenthal - Horst Keller
remediation: Check if the class could be inherited. If not, then add the FINAL addition in its definition.
remediationSample:
* This class must not be subclassed
CLASS counter DEFINITION FINAL.
PUBLIC SECTION.
    METHODS: 
        set 
            IMPORTING VALUE
                (set_value) TYPE i, increment,
        get 
            EXPORTING VALUE
                (get_value) TYPE i.
PRIVATE SECTION.
    DATA count TYPE i.
ENDCLASS.
